inn1.comm: starts off with a length ball which seems to square up Amla as he gets this down to third man for a single
slightly fuller as de Kock works this away to third man to get off the mark
length ball again which comes in as Amla gets forward to defend comfortably
Amla able to work away this length ball to deep midwicket for a couple

fuller ball on middle and leg which Amla fails to get a bat on as Irfan goes up instantly for the appeal. This one rapped on the pads and it looked plumb on first sight. Umpire raises the slow finger of death, and Amla consults with de Kock before deciding against reviewing the decision. Big blow early for South Africa, and Pakistan will be over the moon as Amla falls again cheaply in this series
shortish length wide of off stump that continues on its path as du Plessis is content to let it go
length ball pitching outside off and swings in. De Kock careful in defence
length ball which comes in as de Kock is solid in defence
slightly fuller as it heads for the pads, with de Kock doing well to flick this to the leg side
full and on the pads as du Plessis gets off the mark right away with a gentle clip through midwicket
pitches this wide outside off stump at a good length, which de Kock fails to get away
full again and a bit too straight as de Kock helps this along to deep midwicket
back of a length and going down the leg side as the umpire calls it wide straightaway
fuller and on off stump as du Plessis defends on the front foot with ease
back of a length and spearing to the slips as the second wide of this over is called
shortish delivery in line of middle stump as du Plessis gets on the back foot to defend
back of a length which rises upon pitching as it goes through to the keeper
woah, this one gets even steeper bounce as it rushes through outside off to the keeper
short delivery which rears up at the batsmen, who does well to keep in under control
short of a length on middle which hits du Plesiss on the gloves. Looked painful that
fuller delivery on and around off which de Kock negotiates without much difficulty
length delivery wide of off stumps as de Kock has a go, but misses the ball entirely
good length ball on middle and off which is defended back to the bowler
length ball on middle which de Kock plays away to the leg side
going down the pads as de Kock is unlucky to flick this straight to square leg
a little too straight again from Tanvir as de Kock glances to the deep square leg
short and going down the leg side as yet another wide is called off Irfan. The third of the innings so far
length ball which rises upon hitting the pitch as de Kock just gets this away to the leg side, but for none
short again and just outside off as de Kock tries in vain to cut it away
short of a length as de Kock latches on to this one quickly to pull this in front of square for the first boundary of the day
even better from de Kock, just pushes this length ball past the bowler, and mid on, as this one reaches the long-on boundary
and yet another boundary, but a fortuitous one for the leftie as he almost cuts a length ball onto his stumps, which ends up traveling through to the fine leg fence
would you believe it, almost a carbon copy of the previous delivery and outcome as once again de Kock drags this with the ball just missing the stumps, and a short third man, to the fine leg boundary
fuller length ball just outside off as du Plessis drives through the covers
length ball on and around off stump as de Kock defends this back to the bowler
short again and de Kock unfurls the pull just in front of square, with square leg able to reign this in before the boundary
slower ball just outside off as de Kock almost drags this onto his stumps
length ball outside off which de Kock flashes at straight to cover
length ball on and around off which de Kock pushes to mid off
lovely flighted delivery that turns in as du Plessis does well to defend
shorter one which turns in quite a bit as du Plessis gets on the back foot to try and work this away to the leg side
length ball outside off which du Plessis does well to negotiate
even fuller this time as du Plessis tucks this around the corner to fine leg
tossed up on middle as du Plessis negotiates it without too much difficulty
length ball again which du Plessis gets forward to defend
length ball again which de Kock plays away to the leg side
length ball again outside off as de Kock drives this down to mid-on
fuller delivery on middle which du Plessis clips to midwicket, with the pair completing a well-run tight single
once again de Kock gets an inside edge, this time to a slower one, as the stumps remain intact
fuller length on middle which de Kock lifts over the bowler's head to the straight boundary. Lovely pickup that from the Saffa southpaw
bang on middle as de Kock does well to keep it out
length ball outside off that turns in as du Plessis defends
similar result from the previous delivery, as du Plessis keeps it out
slightly quicker and just going down the leg side as du Plessis helps it along behind square for a couple
length ball outside off and du Plessis gets on the front foot to defend
back of a length and turning in as du Plessis strides forward in defence
quicker ball on middle and off which du Plessis keeps out
back of a length and outside off as de Kock cuts this away square on the off side, with the pair completing three runs
slightly fuller as du Plessis opens the face to guide this down to third man
fuller this time outside off as de Kock drives this back at the bowler
back of a length and straying down the leg side as de Kock tries to manufacture a shot through the leg side
full and outside off as de Kock drives this down to long-off
slower delivery on a length as de Kock tries to drive this past Tanvir, but to no avail
length ball on middle and turning in as du Plessis is unable to get it away
tossed up as de Kock drives this through the off side, with Nasir Jamshed doing well at silly mid-off to intercept it
de Kock resolute in defence as Ajmal spears one in on a length
slightly fuller as de Kock opens up to drive this through long-off
length ball outside off as du Plessis hangs his bat to glide this through to third man
a quicker one speared in just outside off as de Kock fails to get bat on it
flighted delivery on off as du Plessis tries to work it away
again flighted just outside off as du Plessis negotiates it without too much trouble
seems to hang in the air as this comes in on a length, with du Plessis playing it off the back foot
length ball again which du Plessis dabs down to long-on
de Kock able to steer this through to long-on for one
fired in on middle which du Plessis gets forward to defend
back of a length and turning away from de Kock as he defends it to the left of Ajmal
back of a length again as de Kock is able to push it through to the leg side
flighted up on leg stump as du Plessis backs away to drive this to long-on

length ball right on middle and leg as de Kock, stuck on the back foot, is rapped on the pads. Ajmal likes it, and after some deliberation, the umpire confirms it. Another timely blow for the Pakistanis as de Kock was certainly looking the more fluent of the pair. This one does not appear to be reviewed so it is officially two down for South Afirca

back of a length on middle as this one hits the pads, but looks like there was some bat on it, as Ajmal goes up for the appeal. He now heads over to Misbah to have a consultation as to whether it should be reviewed, but then decides against it
fired in slightly quicker and on a fuller length as JP Duminy strides out to meet the ball. Ball crashes into the pads with Ajmal appealing once again, but this one was always outside the line
nicely driven by du Plessis towards long-off
back of a length and turning in to JP Duminy as he tries to cut it away
this time straying down the leg side, but once again JP fails to get it away
quicker one which JP is able to drive down to long-off for a single
fuller delivery which du Plessis keeps out without too much fuss
length ball on middle which du Plessis is able to squirt away behind square for one and keep the strike
Faf resolute in defence as Ajmal bowls one on a good line
Ajmal follows Faf as he looks to make room, throwing this on middle and leg
same line again from Ajmal, but Faf holds his ground, as this one turns past the pads for a wide
length ball as Faf looks to back away, but then defends it to the leg side
Ajmal throws in the doosra which Faf fails to pick up as he gets a thick outside edge to the off side to get off strike
flighted from Ajmal which JP does well to block
slightly fuller as this one straightens upon pitching. JP strides forward to meet the ball
fuller delivery on middle which Faf clips to midwicket
JP advances down to meet this length ball as he tucks it away to the leg side
fuller length ball which Faf gets forward to work away down to long-on

back of a length and JP, stuck on the back foot, hits this uppishly to silly mid-on, where Ahmed Shehzad is stationed, as Shehzad dives forward to take a good catch. So South Africa are now three down and Pakistan sense they can get some more.
length ball which AB clips down to deep midwicket to get off the mark
Faf able to push this to deep midwicket with consummate ease
floats this just outside off as Faf drives this through cover
drifts in from outside off and on to leg stump as AB tries to tuck this behind square leg
AB tries again to beat square leg
AB able to work this away to long-on
lovely drift again as Faf clips this down to mid-on
back of a length as AB tries to work it away off the back foot through the off side, but to no avail
fuller length delivery just outside off which is allowed through to the keeper
full again as Faf hits this straight to mid-on, who fails to get a good grip on it and throw down the stumps. Hafeez visibly upset about his effort
fuller again as AB gets a slice on the ball through third man, beating a squarish third man to the boundary
fuller length and AB gets a thick outside edge which dies on second slip. Another blunder from the Pakistanis. They really should get these sorted
this time AB steps in to the ball pitched outside off and allows this through to the keeper
length ball which AB cuts away through the off side
loopy delivery outside off which AB plays uppishly towards cover
back of a length as Faf gets this away to the leg side
AB resolute in defence to one which pitched just outside off
fuller length on and around off which AB presses forward to defend
AB leans into a drive which sweeper cover is able to intercept and throw back to the keeper
drifts this on middle and leg as Faf drives this down to long-on
fuller length just outside off as Faf shoulders arms
similar length just outside off which Faf dabs down to third man
length ball this time in the same channel as AB glides this gently down to third man
back of a length which just passes the angled blade of Faf. Lovely delivery that from Irfan
slightly fuller this time as Faf goes for the booming drive, but is defended by cover competently
full and just outside off as Faf times this to extra-cover, and is able to beat the incoming throw at the non-strikers
drifts this just outside off as Faf is resolute in defence
loopy delivery on middle and leg which Faf tries to work away down to long-on
speared in on leg as Faf defends on the front foot
drifts this on off as Faf is able to squirt this away to the leg side and get off strike
length ball on middle and leg which AB clips down to long-on for one
pitched just outside off as Faf gets on the front foot to defend
length ball just outside off which AB allows through to the keeper
low full toss but AB is unlucky to hit this straight to mid-on. That was a hit-me ball there from Irfan, the South African captain should have done better
length ball that just shapes away as AB goes for the drive, just narrowly missing the edge
back of a length on the same channel as AB defends on the back foot
full again as AB shuffles down to drive this towards sweeper cover
length ball that just leaves the batsman as Faf tries to work this away to third man
drifting this down the leg side as AB tucks this away to the leg side
length ball wide of off stump as Faf drives this to long-off
slightly fuller on middle as AB tries in vain to dab this down to third man
similar delivery again which AB, meaning to play to the off side, ends up hitting it on the leg side, and goes for the single on offer
length ball which Faf dances down to hit through long-on with some force, which beats the boundary rider without any issue. Met by quiet from the crowd
playing from the crease there as Faf keeps it out
back of a length delivery which AB seems to hang his bat to as it goes to the keeper
back of a length on middle which AB keeps out
back of a length again as AB moves to the off to try and work away to the leg side
shortish length outside off which climbs appreciably as it travels to the keeper
this one pitches closer to the body as it seems to rise again on Faf, who tries to squeeze this away on the off side
length ball outside off which Faf, thinking about a shot, decides to let through to the keeper
fuller length ball on off which AB drives to extra-cover
length ball on off which Faf defends on the front foot
length ball on middle and off which Faf pushes towards cover, with the pair setting off for a quick single
AB plays this off the back foot towards deep midwicket
spears this one in on middle and off which thuds into the pads. Pakistan appeal, but the umpire is having none of it
slightly fuller length as Faf does for the cross-batted swat through the off side
length ball on and around off which AB tucks away to midwicket
length ball just outside off which Faf hangs his bat to, as the ball beats the outside edge
back of a length outside off which Faf tries to squirt away to the off side, but finds point
back of a length outside off as Faf shuffles over to the off side to turn this to the leg side
back of a length outside off which Faf gets a bat on to guide towards the square/third man region
fuller length ball outside off which Faf drives down to long-off
length ball which kept a bit low as AB steers this down to mid-on
speared in on middle and off which Faf drives comfortably down to long-off
good delivery there from Afridi, pitched on middle as AB tried to work this away to the leg side
AB unable to move much in the crease as Afridi fires one on a middle stump channel
fuller this time as AB goes for the drive down to long-on
drifts this one on middle and leg as Faf, seemingly waiting on the leg side, charges in to defend this delivery heading to the stumps.
length ball on middle and off which AB steers to deep midwicket for a quick-ran three
length ball outside off which Faf nudges towards point
length ball outside off which is tucked away towards deep midwicket
shortish length on off as AB gets on the back foot to punch this past mid-off
back of a length on leg as Faf hits this back towards the bowler
length ball which Faf meets with a lofted pull on the up through a vacant deep midwicket for a much-needed boundary
back of a length which AB pushes down to long-on off the back foot
this time throws in a doosra which turns away from Faf, who played all around it. Keeper goes for the stumping but Faf was behind the crease.
Faf looking to advance down but is unable to pick the gap on the off side
flighted on middle as Faf goes for the drive down to long-off
back of a length as AB goes for the cut, but finds cover
another single off the bat as AB drives this towards long-off
back of a length on a leg stump line which AB clips away to deep midwicket
fuller length delivery outside off which Faf tries to glide through to third man
length ball on middle which Faf dabs down behind square on the off side
back of a length again as AB gets on the back foot to punch this down to long-off
back of a length which Faf fails to work away to the off side
length ball outside off which AB drives in front of square
drifting this outside off as Faf defends on the front foot
length ball on middle and leg which Faf is able to tuck away to the leg side
this one straying down the leg side as the batsmen are able to come back for a couple. Wide is called despite all the theatrics to try and dissuade the umpire
length ball on middle which AB plays back to the bowler
short ball as AB gets on the back foot to manufacture a single as this travels down to long-on
Faf drives this length ball, beating a diving extra-cover inside of the ring
back of a length outside off as AB steers this through extra-cover
back of a length outside off which AB works away to the off side
fuller length on middle as Faf is able to drive this comfortably to long-off
back of a length which AB guides down to short third man

and Pakistan strike, just after I spoke about how Junaid had been lacking inspiration. Du Plessis, looking to cart this over midwicket, instead hits this back of a length ball straight into the waiting hands of deep square leg, who doesn't make any mistakes. Threw away what would have been a real fighting fifty there from the vice-captain
back of a length as Junaid spears this on AB, who does well to defend
length ball outside off which AB drives straight to point
Afridi, going round the wicket, gets this to just beat Miller's edge on the way to the keeper. Miller did not pick it at all
Miller does well to negotiate this one which turns in on him from the same spot as before
drags this one a bit on middle and leg which Miller is able to nudge down to long-on to get off the mark
AB drives this straight to cover to a delivery flighted right on middle
back of a length as AB is able to cut this away off the back foot
fuller length ball just outside off as Miller goes for the drive
back of a length on middle and leg which Miller hits directly to silly mid-on
back of a length outside off which Miller defends to the off side
length ball on and around off which Miller tucks away to midwicket
back of a length and going down the pads as AB glances this down to fine leg
back of a length outside off which Miller cuts away, but finds point
back of a length on off as Miller defends off the back foot
drifting down the pads as this one hits AB's pad
length ball drifting in yet again as de Villiers hits towards the off side
AB able to work this away off the back foot towards long-on
Miller gives the charge to this back of a length ball as he tucks away to the leg side
AB eschews this off the back foot towards extra-cover
Miller able to drive this straight to mid-off to keep strike for the next over
back of a length on middle as this crashes into the pads, with Junaid going up for the appeal. But this was looking too high and probably going down the leg side too

back of a length ball and this one hits the pads yet again. Looked a better shout as the batsmen scamper for the run, with the fielder on the leg side firing in a throw at the striker's stumps. This was an inside-edge however
round the wicket to AB as he drives this overpitched ball

back of a length ball outside off which Miller sees early as he rocks back on the back foot to pull this fiercely to the midwicket boundary. The timing was superb on that one as it rocketed to the fence
length ball on middle and off as Miller gets a single down to third man
pitched in line of middle and leg as AB is able to tuck this away to mid-on
length ball which is steered down to midwicket for one
length ball on off and middle and turning in as Miller steps down to try and pierce the gap on the leg side, but to no avail
Miller able to drive this off the back foot down to long-off
drifting in on middle as AB waits patiently before guiding this down to long-on
speared in on middle as Miller plays this back to Ajmal
similar delivery from the previous one as Miller tries in vain to hit this past the bowler. Good bowling here from Ajmal
back of a length wide of off stump as AB hangs his bat to dab this down to third man
back of a length on and around off as Miller looks for the drive on the off side
low full toss on middle and leg which Miller clips towards deep midwicket
length ball which Miller tries to turn around the corner, but finds backward square leg
low full toss on middle and off as AB drives this straight to mid-off
full and on middle as Miller does well to dig it out
AB looking to back away to make space, but the slowness of the surface is making the ball tough to get away
once again tries to improvise a hoick off the back foot, but ends up dabbing this down to long-on
Miller shuffles down to try and negate the turn as the ball crashes into the pads. An appeal goes up, but it was definitely hopeful

and the torture for Miller is over as he hits this length ball, arguably quicker than the previous few deliveries, straight back to Ajmal off the back foot. Was in no position to play that shot and pays the price ultimately as he is surprised by the quicker one. South Africa lose a wicket in the Powerplay, and they are now 150 for 5
negotiates his first delivery confidently with a front foot prod to the off side
plays this off the back foot as Ajmal spears in a quicker one. McLaren unable to get it away
beaten! good pace, right on that off stump corridor and he gets his customary extra bounce even with the old ball. AB hangs his bat out on the off side to no avail
full on the off stump and he drives to mid-off as his bat face turns on impact. He sets off immediately as Junaid Khan takes aim and throws down the stumps, but the SA captain is well home
back of a length, homing in on middle as he covers the line and blocks towards point. AB calls him through for a single
oh, he's sent back, but the call for no came quick enough for McLaren to make his ground. Pushes the length ball on off stump to mid-off and wants a non-existent single
seemed a little slower there, as AB waits on the back foot for it to come to him and dabs it away to third man
down the leg side, fullish length ball. There was no bat involved as he was looking to clip it to fine leg. That is where the ball ends up and the batsmen take a single
back of a length outside off as McLaren drives this off the back foot to the off side
length ball just outside off as AB goes for the drive
short again from Ajmal as de Villiers sees this early with a lofted short-arm pull through midwicket. It also brings up his 50, which has been an innings of real substance on a tough, slow pitch
AB tries to nudge this away to the leg side, but fails to get a meaningful connection on it
back of a length and straying down the pads as McLaren helps himself to it with a gentle glance to the fine leg boundary
short again from Irfan, and with some width as well, as McLaren cuts this away behind square for another boundary
short again from Irfan, this time closer to the body, as McLaren decides to shoulder arms
back of a length, just outside off, as McLaren gets an inside edge behind to the keeper who throws it at the striker's end with success, but AB was too fast
length ball which AB tries to whisky away to the leg side
fuller length ball outside off as AB goes for the drive through mid-off
fuller length ball on middle and leg which AB tries to steer towards the leg side
back of a length outside off as AB steps back to make space before cutting it with all his might to the extra-cover boundary
length ball on middle and leg as AB gets on one knee to slog sweep behind square to the fine leg boundary. Outstanding pressure
fuller length on middle as AB defends on the front foot
back of a length as AB is able to negotiate this to the off side for one
back of a length again as McLaren gets on the back foot to defend
and AB meets him with disdain as he glances this leg side ball down to fine leg for four
length ball on and around off as AB advances down the pitch to try and work this to the leg side
back of a length again as AB defends resolutely. Splendid batting here from the captain in light of the pitch and the slowness of the wicket
slightly fuller length as AB nudges this down to long-on
length ball outside off which is edged down to third man
back of a length and spearing in as AB works this down to long-on
back of a length and slanting in as AB pushes this down to long-on
back of a length on the pads as McLaren and AB run the leg-bye
length ball outside off as AB dances down to drive this towards the extra-cover regio n

back of a length as AB waits on the back foot to play a lofted pull over deep midwicket, but doesn't time it well enough, as it lands inside off the boundary in between the two fielders near the ropes. Good fortune there for the South African captain
full and wide as AB goes for an improvised sweep in order to hit a vacant fine leg, but ends up hitting it on to his leg, and running the bye
length ball on middle and leg as McLaren steers this straight to midwicket
speared in on middle as AB drives this straight down the ground, with long-on intercepting it
length ball just outside off as McLaren guides this behind square on the off side
slow bouncer outside off as AB goes for a cross-batted swat, which beats the bat, the keeper, and travels on its way to the boundary
low full toss outside off as AB gets under it successfully to angle it to the deep midwicket boundary
length ball on middle and leg that stays low as AB works it away to the leg side
full length ball outside off as McLaren guides this behind square for one, and will retain the strike
full and straight as McLaren chips this over midwicket for an easy boundary
back of a length and comes in as McLaren is just able to glide this through third man. Junaid will feel hard-done by it as that was a fine delivery
full and going down the pads as McLaren helps it along with a lovely clip behind to the fine leg boundary
back of a length outside off as McLaren tries to get it away to third man
back of a length on middle and leg as McLaren is able to nudge this to the leg side
full and wide as AB reaches for a sweep on one knee through to midwicket
AB gets on the back foot as he tries to whisk this away to the leg side. The pair want two but McLaren is sent back, and is able to make a frenetic dive to the crease
spears one onto the pads as McLaren is able to get one away to the leg side for a single
pitches this on a full length as AB quickly gets into position to sweep this round the corner over backward square leg for a boundary
speared in on middle as AB is able to manufacture a drive through the gap at extra-cover for another four
fuller length on middle as AB is able to drive this to the off side for one

fuller length on middle and off as McLaren goes for a sweep himself, but ends up getting an edge and spooning up to backward square leg, who probably cannot believe his luck as this comes down ever so gently into his waiting hands. A little bit late for Pakistan though
fuller length ball which AB drives on the up through cover for another boundary
full and just outside off as AB angles his bat to work this to the leg side. AB on 97 now

full and wide and Peterson is able to drive this comfortably, and I say comfortably in the best way as it is still a tough pitch out there, through to extra-cover. What a stroke to get off the mark, even if it did not fetch a boundary

back of a length, stayed somewhat low, as this nips back to hit the stumps as Peterson goes for the lofted pull through midwicket. Fair play to him as South Africa need to have as much insurance as possible in terms of runs
back of a length and once again nipping in as Parnell fails to get any contact
almost cleans him up here as he goes for a huge mow down the ground, with the ball crashing into his legs
slower ball on and around off as Parnell just pushes this in the gap between mid-on and sweeper cover to find the boundary. Surreal shot that one

McLaren goes for a swat to this length ball outside off, which spoons up to point who fails to get a hand on it. AB wanted three as he dives just in time to make his crease after Irfan, at sweeper cover, throws it in

full and just outside as AB gets on one knee to slam this over midwicket. The Pakistani fielders on the leg side are unable to track it, but somehow it reaches the boundary. Hundred up for the South Africa captain, and a real captain's knock considering the conditions.
how can I describe this to you, length ball outside off and angling in as AB waits on the back foot to just swat this over midwicket for a huge six. This one realtl climbed!
makes himself a bit of room as he lofts this full ball crisply over extra-cover for a boundary
is he captain fantastic or what? full and on off as AB backs away slightly to drive this like a bullet through the inner ring to finish the innings with a four

inn2.comm: back of a length on middle as Hafeez gets on top of it without too much difficulty

down the pads and Shehzad simply clips this through the gap in between square and fine leg. Fine leg was able to stop it, but he ends up hitting the skirting with his body as he tries to deflect the ball, so it looks like a four will be called
length ball with a little width as Hafeez tries to cut this away
length ball just outside off as Hafeez defends once again off the back foot
length ball again on a tight line as Hafeez negotiates this one with consummate ease
shortish length on middle as Hafeez goes for the pull, but ends up getting hit on the stomach as he plays the shot a tad early
length ball shaping in from outside off as Shehzad is resolute in defence
length ball on middle and shaping in as Shehzad defends to the leg side
back of a length on middle as Shehzad clips this off the back foot, which square leg recovers

back of a length on off and middle as Hafeez sticks his bat out, with the ball hitting the shoulder of the bat and spooning over to second slip, who runs to his right and dives, but is unable to get a hold off it. Wonderful attempt there.
back of a length outside off as Shehzad drives this on the up square on the off side
Hafeez looking to come down slightly as Tsotsobe spears this on a fuller length
fuller length just outside off as Shehzad presses forward to defend
length ball on the same channel as Shehzad defends once again
back of a length outside off which is played away to cover
back of a length on middle and leg as Shehzad tries to work it away
back of a length outside off which is defended to the off side with a back foot punch
length ball coming in as Shehzad is unable to work it away to the leg side
short of a length just outside off which Hafeez defends back to the bowler
full and just outside off as Hafeez goes for the drive
full and coming in from just outside off as Shehzad defends to the leg side
length ball on middle and leg which Shehzad tries to clip, but finds the fielder on the leg side

back of a length on leg stump as Shehzad plays a lovely calypso hook of sorts, which sails ever so lovely into the hands of Vernon Philander, who was stationed at deep fine leg. First wicket down and South Africa on their way. Pakistan have a major hurdle to overcome here
Hafeez unable to work away this length ball to the leg side
same result as Hafeez just defends this off the back foot
length ball outside off which Hafeez drives straight to mid-off
length again from Philander as Hafeez simply can't get it away

fuller this time on the same line, except this time Hafeez plays all around it as this one comes in and knocks back the middle peg. Two down for just eight on the board. A familiar scene is unfolding here folks
bouncer which Amin just allows to go over him as he ducks under it
Tsotsobe probably feeling a little sorry for the Pakistan batsmen as he fires this one wide outside off, with the umpire calling a wide
length ball shaping back in as Maqsood does well to defend off the back foot
slightly fuller this time as Maqsood goes for the drive
full and outside off as Maqsood is content to allow this through to the keeper
full and just outside off as Maqsood unfurls a lovely drive through the covers, but is stopped at the inner ring
short ball this time as Maqsood gets on top of it without much fuss
another bouncer from Tsotsobe, with even more bounce, as this one wraps Maqsood on the arm and then goes over to the keeper. Called wide because of height by the umpire
wide outside off, although could be seen as a harsh call, as the umpire calls a wide. Tsotsobe likely not to send him a Christmas card this winter
gets this closer to the body as Maqsood punches this straight to cover
length ball on middle and off which Amin defends back towards the bowler
length ball on and around off which Amin directs towards short cover
slightly fuller on the same line as Amin drives this straight to the same fielder
bouncer from Philander which Amin ducks under to allow through to the keeper
length ball outside off which Amin plays back to silly mid-off
back of a length which Amin latches onto quickly as he rocks back to pull this behind square for the second boundary of the innings
back of a length outside off as Maqsood punches off the back foot towards cover
back of a length which seems to square up Amin as the ball ricochets to the off side
full and straight as Amin looks to pierce the gap between mid-on and long-on
length ball on middle which Amin fails to get away
length ball just outside off as Amin goes for the drive, with the ball just missing the outside edge
back of a length and straying down the pads as Amin glances this uppishly square on the leg side, with the ball just evading the grasp of two South African fielders positioned near it

fuller length ball on a middle stump line as the ball crashes straight into the pads. Philander is adamant and the umpire raises his finger. The batsmen think about a review, but decide against it. Replays show it was even more plumb than I had thought. So three down and Pakistan on 17. South Africa looking to go for the jugular
length ball on and around off which is defended competently
full again as Misbah is able to eke this out to the off side for a single and get off the mark
back of a length and coming in as Maqsood stands tall to defend this
full and just outside off as Maqsood drives this crisply through the covers, but the outfield is slow so this fails to make it to the extra-cover boundary
length ball outside off as Misbah shoulders arms
full length delivery just outside off as Maqsood tries to get it away to the off side
back of a length this time on a middle stump line as Maqsood defends back to the bowler
back of a length delivery as Maqsood stands tall to swat this away from outside off all the way to the midwicket boundary. Sensational shot that from Maqsood
Maqsood follows that up with a lovely punch down the ground, and if it wasn't for the slow outfield, this would have gone all the way to the boundary. Lovely batting this
back of a length outside off as Maqsood tries to work it away to the off side
length ball which Maqsood pushes towards mid-off
length ball outside off as Misbah goes for the cut, but point is able to stop it
fuller this time on the same line as Misbah is able to steer this behind to third man
good change-up from McLaren as he fires in a bouncer which squares up Maqsood
back of a length and angling in as Maqsood is able to get in line of the ball
full and on middle and leg which Maqsood is able to keep out
excellent bouncer from McLaren to finish the over. Maqsood almost gets his throat cut as it jags back upon pitching
length ball outside off which Misbah allows through to the keeper
Misbah takes a full pitched delivery and just heaves it down the ground. This one went miles in the air, but carried just far enough to get over the rope. What a shot from the Pakistan captain
full and just outside off as Misbah tries to squirt this away to the off side
same channel again from Tsotsobe as Misbah gets forward to defend
full and just outside off as Misbah goes for the on drive
full and just outside off as Maqsood glides this down to third man
length ball outside off as Maqsood bludgeons this to the long-on boundary with a one-bounce four
length ball pitched wide outside off as Maqsood drives towards cover
attempted bouncer which goes down the leg side, with the umpire calling a wide
back of a length and angling in as Maqsood stands tall in defence
shortish length as Maqsood goes for the pull, but ends up hitting this straight up, but luckily falls in between both mid-on and off
Maqsood gets a thick outside edge to a full delivery as it beats a sprawling Amla at first slip to the vacant third man boundary
drags this first ball as it spins away from Misbah who is backing away. Misbah cuts this but there is no backing the non-strikers, so extra runs allowed
Misbah starting to back away in order to give himself some room, but fails to get this away

length ball just outside off as Misbah reverse sweeps through third man. Fielder able to drag it before the boundary, but replays show that it was indeed a boundary. Good effort though from David Miller
back of a length as Misbah just pokes at this towards the off side
once again looking to back away but instead plays it towards the leg side
length again as Misbah prods forward to steer this to the off side
back of a length and defended off the back foot by Misbah
back of a length again as Misbah defends to the off side
length ball outside off which Misbah fails to get a bat to as it goes behind to the keeper
back of a length again as Misbah defends to the off side
almost a carbon copy of the previous delivery as Misbah gets his bat down in the nick of time
back of a length and shaping in as Misbah is staunch in defence
flighted delivery outside off as Maqsood gets a thick outside edge which almost carries to the third man boundary. Amla does well to rein it in
length ball on middle which Maqsood defends
dances down the track to chip this over to long-on
fuller this time as Misbah is able to eke this away behind square
back of a length outside off which Maqsood fails to get away on the off side
length ball again and Maqsood directs this straight to silly mid-off
length ball and slanting in as Misbah defends

back of a length and Misbah goes for the pull, finding short mid-on without any trouble. He was in no control of it, and he falls, for less than a fifty. I can scarcely believe it myself. This is headlines stuff.
Umar ends up gliding this behind to third man to get off the mark
length ball just outside off and nibbling just away as Maqsood draws in his bat
back of a length and Maqsood just works it away to the off side
full and on middle and leg as Umar tucks this away to the leg side
Umar goes for a lofted shot behind square, just going over the inner ring
speared in on middle and off which Umar keeps out
Umar presses forward to defend this length delivery
drifts this one in from outside off as Umar is able to work away to the leg side
back of a length that seems to hold in the air as Maqsood cuts this away in front of square
flighted on off and middle as Umar advances down to drive this to long-off
back of a length on middle and off which Umar works away to deep midwicket
length ball that comes in as Maqsood stands tall in defence
slightly fuller on the pads as Maqsood fails to turn this away to the leg side
short ball outside off which Maqsood cuts away behind square
back of a length that is steered down to third man for one
back of a length on and around off which Maqsood pushes towards mid-off
Umar drives this full length delivery towards long-off
length ball just outside off as Maqsood dances down to drive this over extra-cover for a lovely shot. Fantastic shot there
speared in on middle and off as Maqsood fails to get this past the bowler
Maqsood steers this length ball towards the leg side to get off strike
floated ball that goes on with the arm, Akmal lunges forward and defends it to the leg-side
Akmal punches this off the back foot down to long-on
length ball just outside off as Umar tries to beat the slips with a deft touch to the third man fence
back of a length as Umar is down the track to punch this towards the covers
back of a length on middle and leg as Umar gets tall to glance this away to the leg side
length ball on middle and off which Maqsood gets down to punch past the bowler. Beats mid-on but long-on is able to come and recover it
full and on and around off as Umar gets forward to defend
back of a length on middle as Umar gets on his toes to tuck this away to midwicket
and Akmal greets him with a walk down the pitch, turns the full length ball into a half-volley and lofts it with a lot of bottom hand straight down the ground
immediately goes back of a length on and around the off stump as Akmal blocks
braves a walk down again, but this one is quicker at 131 kph and much shorter and Akmal has to dab it away to point
shortish outside off stump again and he steers it down to third man with a late cut
slammed into the covers off the back foot. length ball outside off and he just hit that one a little too hard, I think
and its Maqsood's turn to walk at the bowler, but it doesn't reap much reward as the length ball just outside off is turned away into the midwicket region
143 kph, as this one is shortish around the off stump and the batsman goes back and uses the pace on the ball to guide it down to third man off the back foot
too short and called wide. That sailed over Maqsood's head, even if it was directed at middle stump

oh my God! There's another brilliant example of the power he has, especially on the back foot. It was a back of a length ball on middle, nothing too wrong with it, but he deems it has to go and just pulls out a tennis forehand over mid-on
fullish length ball just outside off stump and it was punched smartly off the back foot and AB dives to his left to field the ball, but the batsman have already taken the single
a little slower this time, on and around the off stump again as Akmal opens the face and runs it down to third man
strays on the pads with a back of a length ball and is clipped just square of midwicket

dropped that was poor from the keeper. Regulation take bungled. Full length ball going on with the left-armer's angle and the batsman was looking to steer it away to third man again, gets a thick edge and it went straight into his hands and he spills it
length ball which is tucked away towards mid-on
length ball as Umar angles his bat to play this to the leg side, but hits it past the bowler instead
slow bouncer this time which Umar is able to pull away behind square, but finds the fielder
bouncer from Philander as Umar tries to pull this by rolling his wrists, but the ball is not timed sweetly
length ball outside off as Umar glides this down to third man
bouncer again from Philander, although this time the umpire has signalled it wide
back of a length again as Maqsood fails to get this away
back of a length and Umar stands tall to guide this behind square for a sweetly timed boundary
length ball on and around off as Umar whisks this away through the off side
back of a length and Maqsood cuts this away beautifully in the gap between point and cover, however doesn't time this well enough for it to reach the boundary
short and wide and Akmal just slaps this through the covers, but finds sweeper cover
length ball which Maqsood tries to pull through midwicket, but JP Duminy is up to the task
back of a length on the pads and Maqsood merely flicks this behind to beat backward square leg to the boundary
length ball just outside off as Umar goes for the drive through long-on
Maqsood sweely times a drive which is intercepted by JP Duminy stationd at extra-cover
another short ball as Maqsood is able to keep the pull down
length delivery which squares up Umar

dropped short ball, with the ball rising upon pitching, as Umar does not keep this down as this balloons to square leg, with AB running hard and diving to get a hand on it, but the ball bobbles out of his hand
good length ball on off, Maqsood stays back and turns it to mid-wicket
length ball going down the pads as Umar clips this behind gently to get a coupl e
length ball as Umar gets forward to defend
going down the leg side as Umar tries to work it away

this one speared on the pads as Umar plays all around it going for the sweep. JP appeals and the umpire raises the finger. Replays show the ball to be in line and plumb, with no chance of an inside edge. Akmal goes for the review and it is three reds so a review has been wasted, and Pakistan are now five down
length ball which straightens as Afridi does the sensible thing straightaway to get off strike with a flick to midwicket
low full toss which is driven down to long-on to end the over
shortish length ball that rises as it carries through to the keeper
length ball on middle and off which is worked away to the leg side
back of a length which is glided down to third man
Afridi going for the straight drive to this fuller length ball from Tsotsobe
back of a length outside off which is clobbered by Afridi to the deep midwicket boundary
length ball again as Afridi pulls out the pull once more, but this time finds the fielder on the square leg boundary
length ball on middle and off which Afridi paddles behind square
back of a length and Maqsood unfurls a lovely back foot drive through the covers for four. On 49 now
length ball on middle which is played back to the bowler

length ball on leg as Maqsood tucks this away to the leg side to bring up his second consecutive 50, and that too in just two ODI innings, to carry on from his debut 56 from the last match. He has been a sight to behold amid all the rubble
speared in on leg as Afridi works this behind to backward square leg
full and on middle and leg as Afridi goes for the heave over long-off, but doesn't time it well enough, as it falls harmlessly onto the outfield
bang on off as Afridi drives this down to mid-off
length ball angling in as Maqsood punches this straight to extra-cover, just beating the incoming throw at the non-strikers
slower ball outside off as Afridi goes for the whack, but fails to get a connection on it
this one splaying down the off side as a wide is immediately called by the umpire

back of a length and Afridi is in no control of this pull as it goes straight up, with Parnell waiting under it to complete a tumbling catch. And with that Boom Boom comes and goes. Pakistan in serious trouble at 128 for 6
back of a length on off, Tanvir stands tall and defends it to the off-side
defends this one off the back foot towards the off side
Maqsood charges down to heave this over extra-cover, with the fumble from the fielder allowing for the extra run

and unfortunately Maqsood gives in to the pressure as he goes for yet another heave down the pitch, but spoons it up straight over the long-on fielder, who takes the catch. End of yet another excellent innings from Maqsood. Hard to believe this is just his second ODI
lunges forward to defend this length ball, but misses the ball
flighted ball on off, Ajmal lunges forward and defends it back to the bowler
floated ball just outside off, Ajmal goes back and pushes it to cover
back of a length as Ajmal is able to work it away to the off side for a single
length ball outside off as Ajmal hangs his bat, with the ball missing the edge

fuller length ball and going down middle and leg as Ajmal misses this completely. It looked a good shout from here as the umpire deliberates before giving it out. Pakistan have no reviews so Ajmal has to agree with the marching orders
full and just outside off as Irfan fails to get a bat on it. And fair play to him, must be hard to get your bat down when you are 7 foot 1
full and just outside off as Irfan gets his down in time. Bat looks like a toothpick compared to his massive frame
back of a length and it just thuds into Irfan's hip guard
full and on the money as Irfan is successfully able to keep this out
back of a length and straightening as Tanvir tries to work it away to the leg side
slightly fuller as Tanvir prods forward to defend
flighted on middle as Tanvir plays this back to the bowler
back of a length which Tanvir defends to the off side
defended again to the off side on the front foot
on off stump as Tanvir angles his bat to try and get this away to midwicket
back of a length which is defended towards the bowler

would you believe it! Irfan has been bounced out. I am in shock. Parnell gets this to rear up at a vicious height as Irfan flays at the ball with his bat in order to protect his head, with the ball spooning up to a rather bemused looking Hashim Amla, who takes an easy catch. Pakistan nine down
back of a length and going down the leg side as de Kock does well to get to it, and then throws at the striker's end , with Tanvir short of his ground. Could have been all over
wide down the leg side as Parnell attempts to get his radar back on track
back of a length which is left alone by Tanvir as it carries to the keeper
fuller length ball outside off which is hit towards the leg side
length ball just outside off as Tanvir goes for a half-hearted drive
length ball just outside off as Tanvir drives this comfortably through to the long-off boundary
Junaid able to work this away to the leg side off the back foot
fuller length ball which Tanvir gets into position to slog-sweep behind square for four
Tanvir looking to make the runs as he dances down to heave this over midwicket, but doesn't time it sweetly
defended on the front foot by Junaid
Junaid was already in a position to defend even before the ball was delivered, so that tells you about his mindset right there
tries to whip this length ball that is drifting down the pads, but fails to get a meaningful connection
short ball that starts to go wide off the batsmen. Called one for the over by the umpire
length ball outside off as Tanvir swishes at this, but JP is unable to get to it, despite the dive

wow, Tanvir is in a rush here. He takes this short ball and pulls it as Miller, on the square leg boundary, dives fully to his left to try and get a hand on it, but misses the ball entirely. Good effort though
and in the most innocuous way Tanvir edges a McLaren delivery which de Kock snaps up gleefully. Looked like he got a feather of an edge there, with that Pakistan are out for 151
